reviewText: Set against the backdrop of an Alaskan town which faces it's own depression (both capital and small 'D') because the town's only business of a cannery has closed, this movie shows us how a former resident (now in Los Angeles) brings Christmas and renewed hope to his home town via the two feuding trucker brothers portrayed by Schneider and Wopat.  I like to watch this film each Christmas, it is favorite.  I would have given it five stars if they had Schneider and Wopat SING, which they both did so well back in the late 1980's when this move was made... btw, just look at those hairstyles and clothing!  It's a feel-good movie showing the reconciliation of two brother; a brother with his son, and the other brother with is wife.
summary: Enjoyable; Relevent Especially to Recession of 2009...

reviewText: Yup! fueding brothers - I don't think they even understand why.Willow Creek - a little town in Alaska that is losing its Christmas spirit.A teenage boy feeling rejected by his father [Tom Wopat] and not knowing how to express himself.Then we have Pete's ex-girlfriend and Ray's estranged wife - talk about a mix-up.  Complete with flash-backs to bring us up-to-date.Their father's partner asks the men to drive a semitruck load of christmas gifts north to Alaska - to put their fueding aside for this run.Of course, Ray [John Schneider] takes a little side trip to Reno much to his nephews glee.  Yup! trouble again.Of prime importance is the lose of "Christmas Spirit" both in the town of Willow Creek and by the brothers.The slide of the semi into a snow bank was sure worth it.How it comes back into their lives is the wonderful point of the story, an amazingly touching.Definitely Recommended +++++
summary: WONDERFULLY TOUCHING FOR THE CHRISTMAS SEASON

reviewText: I loved this charming, christmas movie! It is a story about two feuding brothers, who are as different as night and day!  One brother Pete(TOM WOPAT), who has always been loyal, and level headed, and dependable, and caring; while the other brother Ray(JOHN SCHNEIDER) is wild, and always getting into trouble, and fighting, and he is also very handsome, and he is a real charmer with the ladies!Pete is divorced, with a teenage rebellious son, and Pete is nursing a broken heart over losing his ex-girlfriend, Jesse! Jesse(Kim Delaney) is a very beautiful waitress, who fell in love with Pete's brother Ray, instead of Pete! Jesse and Ray got married! And so from then on ,Pete and Ray became feuding brothers!Meanwhile Ray and Pete, are semi truckers working for Al(Hoyt Axton), who owes a trucking company; Ray and Pete's father, was Al's business partner, and Al's best friend; so after Ray and Pete's father died, Al has helped raise and watch over Ray and Pete!  Al is trying to help his boyhood hometown of Willow Creek in Alaska; Willow Creek is a dying town, that has lost their canning factory, and alot of people has lost their jobs, and no one has much money for Christmas, and for their children! So Al, decides to help the townspeople, and to bring a truckload of toys for the children of Willow Creek!Then Al gets sick, and gets Pete and Ray to drive the truckload of gifts to Willow Creek, which is a long journey, especially with Ray, and Pete, and Pete's teenage son, all going together; and then Ray visits his estranged wife Jesse, and founds out that Jesse is very pregnant, and makes her go with them to Willow Creek! A lot of amazing things happen on their long trip, but when they run into a blizzard, the most amazing thing of all happens for them! And also for the town of Willow Creek, they all learn that Christmas ,is a season of miracle's afterall! The Christmas loving spirit has returned to Willow Creek, full of promise and hope, and love!This is a sweet, heartwarming, charming story about love, and hope, and new beginnings! I highly recommend this movie, I so loved, the pretty home town of Willow Creek, with their warm friendly people! And of course, I just loved seeing John Schneider with his handsome self, he just takes your breath away, and melts your heart, with his charm, and his awesome beauty!
summary: A CHRISTMAS MIRACLE OCCURS IN A BLIZZARD!

reviewText: Saw this movie years ago.  I liked the Dukes of Hazzard, and here we got both of them along with Hoyt Axton tryingto get Christmas to a little hard hit town in Alaska.  This flick gives a whole new meaning to the term road rage, causeit takes place in the cab of the same 18 wheeler.  With this Alaska town looking for the delivery of a Christmas mir-acle, two brothers, a teenage son, and an estranged pregnant wife don't see their own miracle even when it is rightbefore their very eyes.
summary: Oh yes, I remember it well.

reviewText: I grew up watching this movie.  Christmas was a huge event for my family and we always watched a Christmas movie during the weekends.  My initial obsession with the movie came because it's based in Alaska and I was born in Alaska.  This is more of feel good Christmas movie, going through the troubles of family (disobedient children, broken relationships) and in the end it ends with happiness.  If you like Alaska, Christmas, or movies with truck drivers, I'd recommend giving this a shot.  It's definitely an 80s movie, with "Santa Claus: The Movie" type acting and filming.  It's a family favorite in our house and not a year goes by that I don't watch this movie :)
Title: N/A
